questions.question: What is the primary function of a switch in networking?
options: To connect different networks
To interconnect devices within a network
To manage IP address translation
To encrypt network traffic
questions.answer: To interconnect devices within a network

questions.question: What is the role of a router in a network?
options: To manage local device connections
To route packets between different networks
To assign MAC addresses to devices
To broadcast data to all devices
questions.answer: To route packets between different networks

questions.question: What does unicast communication mean?
options: One-to-one communication between a sender and receiver
One-to-many communication to all devices in a network
One-to-a-group communication within a network
Traffic directed to the nearest receiver
questions.answer: One-to-one communication between a sender and receiver

questions.question: What is multicast communication?
options: One-to-one communication between devices
Traffic directed to all devices in a network
Traffic sent only to members of a multicast group
Traffic routed through multiple networks
questions.answer: Traffic sent only to members of a multicast group

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP)?
options: To resolve IP addresses to domain names
To map IP addresses to hardware (MAC) addresses
To encrypt network traffic between devices
To manage routing tables for network traffic
questions.answer: To map IP addresses to hardware (MAC) addresses

questions.question: What does an ARP cache store?
options: Temporary mappings of IP addresses to domain names
Temporary mappings of IP addresses to MAC addresses
Temporary network routes for traffic forwarding
Temporary DNS records for faster resolution
questions.answer: Temporary mappings of IP addresses to MAC addresses

questions.question: What is a key feature of the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP)?
options: Ensures best-effort delivery of packets
Provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of data
Supports multicast traffic within a network
Operates only within local networks
questions.answer: Provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of data

questions.question: What does the Sequence Number field in a TCP segment represent?
options: The number of packets transmitted
The position of the first byte of data in the segment
The total number of bytes in the connection
The identifier for the source application
questions.answer: The position of the first byte of data in the segment

questions.question: What is the function of the Domain Name System (DNS)?
options: To resolve MAC addresses to IP addresses
To translate domain names into IP addresses
To assign IP addresses dynamically to devices
To manage encryption for web traffic
questions.answer: To translate domain names into IP addresses

questions.question: What are the components of DNS?
options: Resolvers, Name Servers, and ARP Tables
Resolvers, Name Servers, and Name Space
ARP Cache, IP Tables, and DHCP
IP Addresses, MAC Addresses, and TCP Ports
questions.answer: Resolvers, Name Servers, and Name Space

questions.question: What does the HTTP GET method do?
options: Sends data to the server
Requests data from the server
Deletes data on the server
Creates a new resource on the server

questions.question: Which HTTP method is used to delete a resource on the server?
options: GET
DELETE
POST
PUT

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP)?
options: To route traffic within a local network
To exchange routing information between autonomous systems
To manage multicast traffic in a network
To assign IP addresses dynamically to devices
questions.answer: To exchange routing information between autonomous systems

questions.question: What is the difference between iBGP and eBGP?
options: iBGP runs within a single autonomous system; eBGP runs between autonomous systems
iBGP supports multicast traffic; eBGP supports unicast traffic
iBGP operates only on private networks; eBGP operates on public networks
iBGP uses IP addresses; eBGP uses MAC addresses
questions.answer: iBGP runs within a single autonomous system; eBGP runs between autonomous systems

questions.question: What is a major flaw of BGP?
options: It does not support encryption
It relies on trust and is vulnerable to route hijacking
It cannot scale for large networks
It requires dedicated hardware for operation
questions.answer: It relies on trust and is vulnerable to route hijacking
